meanings.definition: A group of advisors, assistants, or followers accompanying an important person.
meanings.sent1: The king's retinues always stayed close to him during royal events.
meanings.sent2: The president's retinues included his security detail and personal aides.
meanings.sent3: The retinues of the queen were so loyal that they even knew her favorite tea.
meanings.sent4: As the CEO, he relied on his retinues to navigate the complex world of business.
meanings.sent5: The retinues of the famous actress were like a shield, protecting her from unwanted attention.

meanings.definition: A group of attendants or servants.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy merchant's retinues ensured his every need was met.
meanings.sent2: The royal retinues were always impeccably dressed and ready to serve.
meanings.sent3: The retinues of the magician made his performances even more magical.
meanings.sent4: In the grand mansion, the retinues moved silently, attending to every detail.
meanings.sent5: The retinues of the chef worked together like a well-oiled machine in the busy kitchen.
